Plot: Animated fable about a cliché hunchbacked evil scientist's assistant who aspires to become a scientist himself, much to the displeasure of the rest of the evil science community.
Title: Igor
Writer: Chris McKenna, John Hoffman (additional screenplay), Anthony Leondis (additional screenplay), Dimitri Toscas (additional screenplay)
Actors: John Cusack, Myleene Klass, Robin Walsh, Matt McKenna
tomatoConsensus: With an animation style that apes Tim Burton, and a slew of cultural references that aren't clear enough to reach the crowds, Igor's patched together antics make it hard to see who the film is trying to please.
